page.title: 14 Weaverthorpe Village Hall
page.content: The{Village Hall}is a wooden hut, built for the Women's Institute. When the W.I. ceased here, a{Village Hall {Committee}was formed to administer it and raise money to maintain and improve it, for the villages of{Weaver {-thorpe, Helperthorpe and Butterwick. There is a main room, a largish kitchen, a back room used for storage, and a toilet. The local doctors hold{surgeries} there. The{Parish Coucil}meet there and most indoor{fund-raising events} are held there, especially coffee -evenings,monthly disco's and bingos, the Wednesday Club,( for the elderly), holds monthly meetings there.It can be hired for private parties. Every August the{Village Show}is held for the 3 villages. There are farm, garden, handicraft, cooking and children's competitions.
